description:
Beer specials? Yes. Liquor specials? Yes. Friendly service? Yes. Authentic San Francisco bar? Triple yes.

In addition, if you're a soccer fan, the Dubliner West Portal is the home of the Peña Athletic Club California, the official supporters' group for Athletic Club de Bilbao of LaLiga. The peña meets at least once a month for games. Whenever Basques from the Bilbao/Bizkaia area come to San Francisco, The Dubliner West Portal has become a must-visit!
author: Ryan M.

description: This place is a decent bar. There is a pool table and a couple more tables upstairs.  The bartender was really nice and friendly.   The decor is pretty cool. They have lots of neat artwork and a lot of tvs to watch sports. There are usually a good amount of people here and it has a fun vibe
author: Anna J.

description:
This is my favorite bar in West Portal! It truly is similar to the bar Friends. After a few visits you will have a ton of new friends. Otto is the best bartender I have ever encountered and always have a great time when I stop by. They do alot of customer appreciation nights of BBQ from Sunset 29, trivia night, birthday bashes, etc

If you are looking for a bar with a younger crowd in West Portal, this is your spot!
author: Ryanbradley N.

description:
After having dinner nearby, our group of eight stopped by The Dubliner for one more drink. We walked in on Saturday, February 25th around 9:30pm.

It wasn't too busy as there were only a few people sitting along the bar. They have a larger table in the back, so the girls headed there to sit down. The boys and I stayed at the bar to order some beers. I got a Stella Artois. They have a good amount of TVs scattered throughout. Luckily, I was able to catch the end of a Warriors game. The feel is a little divey, but still comfy and clean. The bartender was really nice and patient as it took a while for the five of us to figure out what we wanted to drink.

Good bar to catch a game while sipping on a few drinks.
author: Elena N.

description: Was in West Portal and thought I'd try a local bar. Why not? Came in on a Tuesday around 1am. Bartender seemed nice but stoned. Was talking to regulars who he knew then had last call around 1:30am, like most bars. Paid for my beer then went out to have a smoke came back in and asked if I could get a shot. Then he did some cleaning and came back and asked me what I wanted. Brought the shot back and charged me $13. I think he forgot that I had already paid for my previous beer. Anyway I paid it anyway cause I just wanted to get out. I dunno, I guess this place is only good if you're a local. Maybe come here with a group during a game night. Nice looking bar though
author: Johny B.

description: This place has charm and class.  I rented the room upstairs for an event and the staff was friendly, helpful, and made the party a great success.  I recommend calling ahead if you want to reserve the room upstairs and letting the owner know how you want the furniture arranged.  I had about 15 people up there with a table of food and there was room to sit down and enjoy a drink away from the noise and crowd downstairs.  The staff went the extra mile for us, they put my cupcakes in the fridge, put my serving dishes through the dishwasher, cleared glasses and paper plates during the event, and even swept up after us.  Be sure to tip generously, these people work hard and deserve all the love.
author: Noah K.

description:
Truly the definition of PUB!

Lots of regulars and plenty to drink. 

There is enough seating to come here with a large group and a nice area upstairs for playing pool as well. There are at least 4 or 5 televisions in here to watch all the current games airing. Was here to watch game 6 of the ALCS.

There was a fair amount of people here when I came in. Most of the folks sat around the bar. 

Just an overall good atmosphere. 

The bartenders are very nice and sociable with the patrons. The lady bartender was a hilarious when I was here. I think she is also one of the owners of this establishment as well, not sure though.

Come and check out this place on a Friday or Saturday night. 

#cheers
author: Robert F.

description: I rank this place as second place in the Power rankings of west portal bars at the moment. It has passed tavern easily a while ago and recently philosophers club too.
author: David A.

description:
Favorite watering hole in the neighborhood. Congenial bartenders who make sure your glass isn't empty for too long. 

The new owners got new keg lines and the beer is fresh as ever. Plus, for a local Irish pub, they can make a pretty good Manhattan!
author: Haeley G.

description: Great spot, clean, fun and very affordable. Great staff, and pretty awesome beer selection. Make new friends and hangout at the bar with a dog!
author: R.J. N.

description: What a great bar with great bartenders.  I always have fun here. Lots of locals and also others that stop by for one and end up staying for more! Great Juke box and they have a pool table upstairs. They have a fun trivia night on Wednesdays and occasional free bbq from Sunset29 which is to die for! Mouthwatering meats, sides and drink specials. You can rent the upstairs for private parties.  The bar do not serve food, but the have menus for tons of places close by for pick up or delivery.  If you have a pup, bring them with you! This place is super dog friendly!! They have bus rides to Giants games and had a trip to the Stanford-Notre Dame game last year. So much fun! Bus ride and road drinks!  What else could you ask for?! They got new beer lines so the keg beer is fantastic. Happy hour specials, parking can be tricky but its way better than further down WP near the tunnel. If you want to have fun, grab a beer, watch a game, this is your place! They will put on any game you want! Plenty of TV's!
author: Beckster B.

description:
The Dubliner is a neighborhood gem filled with friendly staff and patrons. I've been coming to Dubliner for years and FYI as of recently it's under new ownership and they're making the right moves forward (new beer lines, expanding drink selection, repairs, etc). 

FOOD/DRINK: They don't serve food, but you may find a few bags of chips. I've never seen an issue with outside food and I believe it's actually encouraged for you to deliver there. As for drinks, I keep it simple with Gin & Tonics, Tom Collins, or just Hennessey Privilege. Privilege was actually off the menu, but the owner was nice enough to add it to their selection 1 day later. 

AMBIANCE: The bar is shaped like a rectangle, with 1/3 of the space as the bar counter, and 2/3's for tables and a walkway. TV's are practically visible from any seat via the bar or tables alongside the wall. Picture frames take up the majority of the wall space, it's clean, cozy, and welcoming. They have an upstairs as well with 3-4 small tables and a pool table. Does it remind me of an Irish Pub? Not too sure, this is the only one I've been too. 

SERVICE: A clear winner here. The bartenders are amazing, Otto, hands-down is one of the chillest people out there. Someone you can talk too and give it to you straight - no censorship. The owners here are very transparent and hands-on too, I've seen them each time I was there. 

CREDIT CARD: Yes. 

PARKING: It's street parking on WP, but on the blocks that isn't too busy with restaurants (between 14th and 15th ave). If you're coming at night, you won't have a problem - don't drink and drive. ;]

OVERALL: When people generally ask me, "Which Bar should we go to?" Well, Dub's is my answer.
author: Austin N.

description: I was ignored twice when I spoke to the bartender to order drinks and another group was served before me and my boyfriend after we arrived first. When I tried to order a drink, the bartender ignored me and took my boyfriend's order (my boyfriend is Caucasian). This is subtle but  subtle things can be interpreted a certain way by minorities. I won't be going back there.
author: Misun Y.

description: An all-around good place to go to that doesn't disappoint. They know their whiskey and beer here and the food is reason enough to go to this place. Good Shepherd's Pie and unforgettable Monte Cristo.
author: Delinda T.

description:
Hoping for a good irish pub. I typically go to McCarthy's which I like a lot. But I thought I'd try the place down the street because I love irish bars and I want to have many around me. 

I order a Guiness and then go to my table knowing that it's poured in two stages. After a longer wait than necessary I went back to pick it up and the guy still hadn't finished it (he was chatting it up.) and he apologizes explaining (twice) that Guiness need to settle before being poured. 

Really? Thanks, guy. I've only been drinking them for 20 years. (I told him this but he didn't seem to hear me) Oh, and I just got back from Ireland three days ago where they pour a lot feckin' faster. 
Then he charges me $7 for it. Wow and I'm not even in the Mission. 

The bartender was friendly just not attentive. But it was the overall vibe that sucked. It felt like a sports bar (I WAS there to watch the Warrior's game), which is fine if I wanted to go to a sports bar.  

They do have a pool table. A bonus but not enough to make me come back. A lot of testosterone in this place (and I'm a guy who doesn't mind a certain amount of testosterone in a bar, just not frat amount). A very adorable hound was running around though. 

So I went back to McCarthy's after a beer. A lot more chill vibe where I could enjoy the game. To each his own I guess. 

BUT, calling yourself The Dubliner is false advertising. Okay, maybe your grandfather was from Ireland but if you want an Irish bar where people who've lived there work then go to McCarthy's. It's cheaper and more authentic despite the fact it doesn't have all the Irish bling on the walls. I guess it doesn't need to try as hard.
author: Surrly H.

description: First time coming here!! I love it. The guys at the bar seem to know each other pretty well. The bartender is really friendly and their beer department had some great choices
author: Dominique A.

description: My friends took me here on a recent visit to the bay area. They are regulars and I have heard them say how much they enjoy this place more times than I can count. I have to agree with them: it has a very fun vibe and the crowd is warm and relaxed with everyone having fun. Lots of sports fans (big screen tvs around if you're into that) and friendly servers who mix a drink with panache. prices were reasonable and the place was comfortable and clean. If I lived nearby I think this would be a regular watering hole for me too.
author: PJ S.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood bars in the city. Pool table upstairs and Otto is one of the most friendly and on-top-of-it bartenders around.
author: Chris H.

description: Such a fun bar!  Was visiting with my club footed friend Janet and they took such good care of us!  Janet has a HUGE crush on John the owner. Can't wait to hobble back in!!
author: Hallie R.

description:
Came here on  a weeknight and it was almost packed. I came here with a fairly large group so we got seated at the one booth they had. Most seating is 2-3 seats or bar seating. I think the booth is the only place that can seat 6-8. The age range is mixed, but it tends to be more older guys who seem to be regulars. 

Our table just got drinks only. The bartender was nice enough to actually come to the booth and ask for our orders rather than us having to individually go to the bar. I don't remember her name, but it was a nice spunky lady. She even brought out all our drinks and served us. I thought that was a nice touch since most places would just make you get everything at the bar. I would come here again for the great service. I definitely felt welcome here.
author: Cecile S.

description:
Another local bar that's not divy and not odorous, with friendly female bartenders, and without barflies. Mostly locals hang here since it's not convenient to get to unless live in the vicinity. There's a number of plasmas/LCDs all around the bar for whatever one wants to watch, though it is very loud to make out what is said even if the place is half-crowded. There's a couch and a jukebox in the back, with an upstairs loft-like section with a pool table. Beers and drinks are a tad pricy.

The place is packed, or mostly full, on Wednesday Trivia nights (http://www.brainstormer.com/venueDisplay.aspx?venueID=262&state=ca). The special is Pilsner Urquell on these nights, though there are rotating specials along with that. Usually, there are a dozen or more trivia teams, so it is more difficult to win or place (and there are regulars=teams that always end up among the top five each week). The host is this dude who is very fun and down to earth. Our team won once, so it's possible...though we haven't placed again since then. I like to think we retired at our peak.

Milestone: the 300th "Funny" vote's review...
author: Peter L.

description: Great bar/pub to stop by and have a beer or whatever your desire of beverage is. Bartender is friendly and I believe is Irish. :-)
author: Liz D.

description: Great neighborhood bar. Bartenders are awesome especially Otto and Erin! They know how to pour a Guinness.
author: Angel D.

description: Great place to watch games!  Tons of TVs, friendly service, and even comfortable sitting room if you're lucky enough to nab a spot.  There's no food, which my friends and I actually love so we can bring in whatever we want and then just order drinks.
author: Carrie C.

description: Horrible little place. I don't know what they do/don't do with their taps, but their beers taste like detergent, all the time. This is a gem of a neighborhood. Just don't go to this dumpheap.
author: Danny B.

description:
JIMMY! 
What a nice little, local, dive bar. Awesome staff, eccentric people, nice atmosphere. 
The bartenders really take their time to get to know their customers. I felt like I had known them my whole life. (A bit dramatic, I know.)

I, young female, go in to watch the Giants game on a Tuesday. I sit at the bar, which is accompanied with an all male cast. I order a Peroni (on draft!). The Peroni had a weird taste. I ask if they have it in a bottle. Jimmy, bartender, says no. He asks what was wrong with and immediatley replaced with a beer that I choose. No hassle. No mean looks or sarcastic remarks. He paid for both beers. What a great guy. I mean, everyone was great. Everyone was nice. It felt like a little Pleasantville in San Francisco. AWESOME. 
Now, they gave me my own couch and I moved in. Just kidding.
author: Jessica L.

description: Small little bar.  Bartender was nice.  Not much of a tap beer selection but still a neat little place. We just stopped in for a quick beer while trying out a few places in the area.  We had our 1 beer and headed to the next location.
author: Leala E.

description:
I can't believe I've not been here before! Shocking! 

Popped in here for a frostie or two on Saturday night - Otto and I had a great natter about British food (yum...suet pudding), and she made me a couple of KILLER martinis (like when I said "extra dry" she knew it meant no vermouth!). 

JJ and I had a couple of games of pool upstairs (I won - hahaha), and we were on our merry way. It was surprisingly quiet for a Saturday night - I had always heard it was heaving in there - but that's fine by me! 

I'll definitely be back!
author: Mi M.

description:
LOVED IT.  Tons of 49ers fan here to watch the 9ers/Packers game and I didn't feel like I was surrounded by douchebags.  

Free hot dogs/sandwiches/chips (don't know if this was a game-day thing, or a usual thing).

Lots of 49ers paraphenilia around.  TONS OF TVs, makes watching the game from any angle you're turned seamless. 

I really am so happy I found a normal sports bar to go watch games at, where the clientele aren't annoying to deal with and I can get a good drink (and apparently a hot dog too).
author: Ghizal A.

description:
I love the Dubliner. I love Otto.  I love their clean bathrooms. 

We really lucked out finding our neighborhood bad just a week after moving to the city.  Otto is the greatest--she remembered us on our second visit from just a brief conversation the week before and has welcomed us with enthusiasm and a cold pint ever since.  

The drinks are strong and the beer selection is on point.  Lots of TVs and lots of great regulars.  Great pool table upstairs and an eternally interesting selection playing on the jukebox. 

It's also next door to the comic book store, so there's that. 

Bottom line: Where everybody knows your name, and you're always glad you came.
author: Kellie T.

description: New ownership and guess what the prices went up $6 for a pint of Anchor Steam. Weekends were much better wit Hank as bartender. Time to find another hangout.
author: Dash R.

description: The Dubliner is a fun bar to watch sports and shoot the shit. If your there on a Tuesday, Thursday,  or Friday go and say Hi to Otto she is a Great bar tender always has a smile and not to mention she's a cutie with a british accent. she is the best and makes the best drinks!  she's quick and attentive to you in every way even if your new to the bar or a regular.
author: Desiree A.

description:
9:45PM, Sat night.

Just came from the Dubliner an hour ago after a less than satisfactory experience.

This is actually a great bar, been coming here for years and I love Otto (Auto?) and Erin, they are amazing bartenders and when they work, this place is really great.

Tonight was a mild night and I came into this establishment for a quick drink.  Before I left, I decided to take a picture of the bar wall with their new little LCD screens so that I could Yelp it.  I intentionally turned the flash of my phone off and took a quick picture of the wall.  A dysfunctional woman came up to me and asked me if I took a picture of her.  I was super nice and told her no, I did not.  I also went ahead and explained that I took a picture of the wall for Yelp and showed her the picture of the wall which had absolutely no faces on it.  Tried to calm her down and showed her the picture again (which showed absolutely nobody) and  told her no big deal, I would delete it while she watched if she desired.

I immediately deleted the image as she watched (which absolutely showed no faces!) and as I did, another patron, a regular there called Victoria (I will be nice enough not to put her last name) flipped out on me.  I tried very nicely FOUR times to explain to her that I will leave her friend alone and that all I am trying to do is explain to her friend that it is no problem.  When she started screaming at me and treating me like shite, I said responded and walked away.  I then told the bartender, Crystal, that out of respect to her, I am leaving because those two women are crazy and I do not want to cause her any drama on her shift.  I closed out my tab, $6.00 on which I tipped $6.00 for a total of $12.00.  I thought both of those things I did for her were beyond cool.

Went to my car right out front and someone outside told me hey, you better take a look at your car, I then realized that Victoria had scratched up my car.  I called the police station and they told me to come in tomorrow to file an official report.  When I got home, I called the bartender, Crystal, to let her know about the vandalism and was hung up on.  She wanted no part of it.  This is not right!  I know Otto (Auto?) and Erin and they would at least have listened...they would not have been that way.  Too bad they were off tonight.

I don't know...what can I say?  I used to like this bar a lot, but after this experience, will never come here again.  What would have been a five is now a one.  ONE STAR for outstanding compassion and customer service, unstable patrons, and lord knows what else.  Yelpers, take note.  DO NOT take pictures of the wall in in here. :(
author: Roy N.

description: Otto is my bartender here, she is great. Makes the night fun every time which is why I am here every Tuesday and Thursday I can.
author: Tommy F.

description: Great bartenders and vibe. It can be hard to maneuver sometimes when it's packed and can be kinda awkward. Overall a great bar to go to to meet up with some friends and chat.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Been coming here since I turned 21 ;) 

The bartenders (love you Otto and Crystal) are super friendly and the atmosphere is great. 

Pool table upstairs. 

Clean.

Jukebox

Artwork.

5 Stars!

NOTE: This place gets AWESOME on St. Patrick's Day.
author: Justin C.

description: the bartender, Otto, was the sweetest! good atmosphere. went on a Tuesday night and there were a lot of regulars. none the less had a good time. the upstairs has a pool table, seats, and a tv.
author: Angelica T.

description:
In no time at all, we've become quite fond of this place and its regulars on Friday nights. You'll find all sorts of people here, and everyone is chill and gets along.

True story - one Friday night during baseball season: 
We're walking towards the place, and chat with a nice lady walking her dog. She's new to the neighborhood, and asks if we were going to watch the Giants game (we had our gear on) and where. We point to the Dubliner, and tell her that it's cool. 

About half an hour later, she walks into The Dubliner and checks it out.  We chat a bit more, and she's fascinated that Briar the dog is a welcome and well-loved regular at this place, too. She calls her partner on her mobile, tells her that they should meet here for a drink.

Her partner arrives - she's a little skeptical, you can see it in her face. Everyone lets them chill for w while. Soon after that, I look over and they're both having a good time. Both later told us that they never thought that this place was so welcoming.

They've been back on the regular ever since :-)

Ah, San Francisco. Even in West Portal, you can be what you want to be ... and it's alright.
author: V. L.

description: Tony the bar tender was so attentive all night mixed fantastic drinks and was very friendly. I would love to see him here more often.
author: Samanntha L.

description: $4 pints, free hot dogs and no crowd to watch football on Sundays.  Need I say more?!
author: Michele S.

description:
Sunday Night is the night to go to this bar, $3 drinks for happy hour and free pool.
The female bartenders are the best, they know how to make everything, and are always gung-ho to try something new.
Jukebox takes cash or card.
Tons of tv's always showin whatever game is on.
You're allowed to bring in food and even order delivery to the bar, which is awesome when you're gettin tipsy!
This is my nieghborhood hangout, and I love it to pieces.

*As a disclaimer, I don't drink beer, only mixed or hard drinks, so I can't comment there.
author: Angie L.

description: Great drinks at an even better price.  Only came here to get shots because they were cheap, dive bar!
author: Wally W.

description:
Nice cozy clean bar!  
Hank is a scholar, gentleman, and nice bar tender!
Nice place to enjoy sports, good crowd!
Thanks!
author: Gary L.

description: This is a standard bar, Irish because of some of the decor I guess.  Nice service but WAY too cramped.  Would be fine on a week night but on a weekend I headed to the Philosopher's Club because it's roomier and Josh is nice to look at :)
author: Emma H.

description:
Went here Saturday for drinks and really liked the place. Apparently it has a good reputation city-wide, and I am glad it is close to where I live in the more hopping area. It was not crowded at all, and the bartender always friendly and nice. I asked suggestions to try new drinks, and I was not disappointed. There is also an upstairs room that we had all to ourselves for a while. There are comfortable tables and booths downstairs, but I preferred being upstairs since it was more secluded, you could see what was happening in the whole pub from there, and there was a pool table! 
I had read on Yelp that this place is praised for its very clean bathrooms, and I must agree. I was amazed and relieved that this was true. Some places literally don't care about what the bathrooms look like, but not here! Also, they were in the very back in spacious area of the premises. 
Lastly, I was super satisfied with the prices of the drinks and beer I had. I think there was some kind of special going on and even though it was not openly advertised I was eventually pleasantly surprised with the check.
author: Dodi G.

description:
I spent my first year and a half in San Fran looking for a pub to call my own; a place I could pull up a stool, pull out a book, and just work on a nice afternoon pint.  That search ended when I found the Dubliner.

For someone who lives in the Sunset, the Dubliner can't be beat.  It's a place that encourages regulars, but welcomes strangers.  They'll treat you how you want to be treated, as long as you respect the pub.  I've never had poor service, and I've never seen a respectful customer been treated with less than A-class attitude.

The bartendresses are lovely ladies to a one, and well worth getting to know.  If you're looking for a solid quiz night spot, they host a Brainstormer here on Wednesdays, and it usually gets a lively crowd.

All in all, the best pub in West Portal, and my go-to in the whole of the Sunset.
author: Franklin G.

description:
I would say that this is the nicest bar in West Portal. I visited this bar on a Saturday afternoon with a friend of mine. The bar prtion was all dudes watching sports and talking smack to eachother. 

We headed upstairs to play pool. (1.00 per game) Its a pub folks, not a wine bar. Although they do serve wine, I don't reccomend it. Stick to beer and mixed drinks. 

There are 4 bathrooms here, a mens, two unisex and in the very back the cleanest ladies room I have encountered in ANY bar ever.
author: Amanda L.

description: The service was great! Otto was an amazing bartender! Great atmosphere and not at all crazy.  They have Smithwick's and do a "proper pour" unlike most pubs.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
I've come to this place  a few times and this last visit takes the pie for the worst bar I have ever been to. First off I would like to say that DISCRIMINATION is a form of racism. 

I came in with a friend to watch the NCAA finals to knock back a few drinks and enjoy the game on Monday 4/4/2011 at approx 6:30 p.m.. Man we made a wrong decision even stepping foot in this place. The bar wasn't packed or anything. About 12 people to be exact and there was an old man possibly the owner who was the bartender that evening, he had a real bad attitude and screwed up our order. Then he tried over charging us on our first and only round when the sign on the wall clearly says $4.00 for a beer "ALL DAY, EVERYDAY".

I could tell that he didn't like me from the start but we sat and had our drink and watched the 1st half of the game. After wards I walked up to the bar to buy another round of drinks for us. The bar tender kept walking back and forth ignoring me for about 15 mins as I was politely standing there with a $20 bill in hand. Was I not getting something here? I'm a paying customer, I brought a ton of money to spend so we can watch the game, and I'm not getting acknowledged as a customer. Then on the other end of the bar with a simple nod of the head, a customer gets helped out and is served his drinks promptly. Then someone else is served right away right next to me. I waited for the bar tender to come back but every time he walked my way he wouldn't even bother to look at me or make eye contact. It's not like this place was packed at that moment.  

That's when I realized that he wasn't serving me because he was profiling me against my ethnic background. I looked around and there wasn't another ethnic colored person there. At first I thought, "he'll come around and serve me" but as I stood there waiting and waiting the bar tender never even bothered to acknowledge my presence. I felt so DISCRIMINATED against by the worker/owner (possibly) that I vowed to never come here again. 

That man whoever he was, was such an @ss and refused to serve a paying customer. I have told all my friends and my contacts about this experience that I have taken it upon myself to write this review to let everyone know what happened on 4/4/2011  at the Dubliner. 

I ended up going to a diff sports bar that night and was able to catch the last 2 mins of the NCAA Finals game. No thanks to the Discriminating Dubliner.
author: Omar M.

description:
Awesome bloody mary's!! I am constantly in search of the perfect bloody mary.. although no celery, it was DELICOUS!!

Super sweet bartenders, reasonably priced drinks.

There's a pool table upstairs and several televisions. Friendly crowd of people. Seems that there are quite a group of regulars.
author: Neek W.

description: Good place excellent service.. definitely coming back extremely satisfied.. awesome !!
author: Victor R.

description:
Why doesn't anyone come here on Sundays for football? DirecTV complete game package, and free hot dogs/sandwiches/chips! You are all idiots. I mean, don't come, no, uhh, this place sucks. Maybe I'll keep my precious sports bar a secret...

West Portal is seriously under-rated.
author: Warren L.

description:
Decent sized bar with three bathrooms - always a plus in my book when there are ample toilets around!

The layout of the bar is pretty awesome with a pool table overlooking the bar and a long bar that extends to the back. I love coming here to hang out with friends; unfortunately, i'm usually the only Asian in the bar which doesn't bother me TOO much considering I am a "banana." Yellow on the outside and white on the inside, but it is a little disconcerting to know that you're the only non-white person there. 

Also, other than the normal college age white boy group, my group is usually the only group under thirty-five. Not to say this is always a bad thing, but a lot of the patrons at this bar sit by themselves or are "regulars."

All in all, this place is a great place to kick back and chill with friends, but don't expect to meet your future soul mate here.
author: Christina B.

description:
Clean... check 

Clean restroom with a lock?... check

Mildly curt (some are Irish) bartenders... check

Free food on occasion... check

$3 happy hour... check

Free pool... check

Enough TV screens to make most people happy... check

Great selection of alcohol... check

Chance i'm going to get pulled over whenever i leave... check

Will i be back... check
author: Adam X.

description: I AM SUCH A FAN OF THIS BAR! I went my first time this past week by recommendation of a friend. The atmosphere is definitely a local neighborhood bar that's super clean. Even the bathrooms were super clean! The bartender that night was AMAZING. She was friendly and kept the vibe cheerful. At one point, my friend accidentally spilled a full pint of beer and broke the glass. Most bartenders would be super annoyed and give a ton of attitude. She instead was nonchalant about it and did not hesitate to give us another pint. My kinda place. I definitely recommend this place to anyone and will for sure be back!
author: Jess D.

description: This is one of my favorite bars in the city by far. The bartenders here always go way above and beyond to be friendly, and they give you free drink tokens if you've been in there enough. The bar is really nice, very clean. All the classiness of West Portal without any of the snobbiness. Virtual jukebox, pool table upstairs and plenty of tvs. Without a doubt one of my favorite places to spend a night out.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
UPDATE 5-16-07 the "odd wall display" TV's are gone, and smaller LCD's facing the bar have improved this place's coefficient-of-sports-bar by a two to one margin. 

*************

"A good businessman does not an interior decorator make."

 One look inside the latest incarnation of "The Dubliner" bars drives this point home.  The wood you face when you're looking at the bar is stained Oreo-cookie dark, while every other panel in the place is a-la-folding-table simulated blonde oak. The result looks more Modesto-California than Dublin-Ireland.  Televisions are present, but they're freakishly placed in discussion-unfriendly positions.  Two screens sit at the end of the bar, and one-of-two people sitting closest to a TV has to turn their head 180 degrees away from the game to make eye contact with the person behind them.  Other TV's are built into an odd wall display above the entrance to the pool table area. They're too small, too high, and too oddly located for anyone to pay attention to.

The day crowd usually has a half-dozen middle-aged men watching a game.  They're fairly talkative, but interaction between them is stifled by the position of the televisions. Sports fans tend to cramp towards the TV's at the end of the bar, and conversation amongst them can be fairly awkward.

The night crowd started off wall-to-wall on opening night, but cooled down immediately thereafter.  There was a lull for several months, but last time I popped by it seemed like the Dubliner was becoming a post-event hangout for the mid-40's sportcoat-and-evening-gown crowd.  It was around 10 PM, seating was near capacity, and  9-out-of-10 patrons looked just like they'd just gotten back from the Opera.  Several *beautiful* women were on hand...and even though most of them wore sizable commitment-rocks on their off-limits fingers, the better part of them were mature enough for a man in his 40's to admire.  And come nightfall when the lights get dimmed, the blonde oak paneling doesn't look half as bad.  

T.K.'s (the previous tenant) was a gritty place that had it's problems...but it had a soul, and one that perished completely during the process of a tragic remodel.  The new bar is clean and sterile, but utterly devoid of character and decorative virtue.  Sports and decor aside, it's not a bad bar. The night clientele is mature and upscale, surrounding restaurants are plentiful, and the K,L, and M MUNI lines stop within a short walk of the front door.  Still, I've come here in search of the West Portal vibe on occasion, but always wound up feeling like a round peg in a odd-shaped hole.  I'll pop by periodically to see if it evolves....but for the mean time it's got pretty stiff competition from Portal's Tavern across the street.
author: Mike W.

description:
great place to come when you are waiting for the 17 to come or the movies to start. They have all the standard of a bar including beer on tap and a full liquor section and pool tables. The bar tenders are really nice and they even have trivia nights

Not a fan that people are smoking right outside the door making the bar smokey, but I guess I can get over that part. 

They do have really clean bathrooms for a bar so I wish I could give another half star for that
author: Jennifer S.

description: Great staff and bar overall.  Only downside is they don't have a kitchen, but you are allowed to bring food in and eat.
author: Austin G.

description: They pour great drinks. Large in size and also strong. Decent environment with pool table upstairs and an electronic juke box. Decent crowd too.
author: Zoe D.

description: Went into the Dubliner tonight and it was off the hook!!!! Otto and Crystal the bartenders are friggin awesome!! Great place to watch a game and pour down a couple drinks. No drama and a good crowd except........ There was a crazy lady in there whose name was Victoria I think. She was talking crazy crap all night and I think she may be a bit insane. The regulars told me she is fixture at the bar and drives everybody nuts including the bartenders. Hopefully the owner will clue into this and get this crazy lady out of there. She defiantly is a crowd killer!!!! other than that the place rocks!!!!
author: Emotep V.

description: Nice bar with pool room. The bartender Otto is awesome!
author: Eileen S.

description: Great spot. Pool table in the top backroom
author: M R.

description: Tuesdays and Thursdays when Otto is bartending is when I go. Best ever, cheap drinks, mega friendly bartender
author: Camron S.

description:
This is a great place to go to after a long day and just relax with some friends. Whenever I come here, I ALWAYS see someone I knew in high school so that makes for some interesting times. The upstairs area has a pool table and is small, but its a nice alternative to the downstairs area which can get pretty crowded.

I don't come here all too often because there's not much else going on in West Portal, besides Portals across the street, but this is a great local bar to go to for happy hour.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This bar is your typical bar. They have a tv and a small coin operated pool table upstairs. Rumor has it that they have free pool on Mondays and a happy hour. Will need to come and check that out one day.
author: Eugene H.

description:
After writing my Yelp review, the owner of the bar sent me a message apologizing and letting me know that the jerk guy I mentioned was kicked out for good.

I'll probably be back and I'll let you all know how it goes!
author: Jennifer L.

description: every time i come here it gets worse.  The one time i went for my friends birthday and the bartender was more consumed in her own drama than serving the customers. Yesterday i went and the bartender was fine and made a strong drink but there was a guy smoking a cigarette upstairs in the pool room. i was choking on the smoke so i walked downstairs and told the bartender. she yelled at them from her spot. I wish she had kicked them out. Smoking anywhere in CA indoors in not allowed.  I am over trying to go to this bar anymore. This was my last strike.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description:
I've been in bars that are much louder than this, but for some reason here the noise of drunks watching sports on TV was more noticeable. I think it was just that everyone was yelling as if they had to over some loud music or something, when in reality your normal voice would have been A-OK. 

Bathrooms were clean. Free pool. Beers were a little pricier than I would like. Good for a neighborhood that lacks a lot of bars.
author: Stu C.

description: Sometimes you get that feeling that if you're not wasted the day is and that's where this place comes in.  I love both the exterior and interior, in fact this is the only place I like on West Portal.  Great beer selection, been recently enjoying Peroni on tap and always Smithwick's.  Prices are good and bartenders are definitely to my liking.  TV is always on sports which is the only time I watch any (when I glance up). I guess it's  pretty much got it all.
author: Sin F.

description: The service is pretty good (the lady bartender- I do not know her name- is always very nice) but I have never had a beer here that didn't taste a little off. The weird-tasting-ness has been so consistent that I don't think I'll be going back anymore...
author: Rika Y.

description:
The Dubliner is by far my favorite place to relax in San Francisco. Particularly I enjoy the trivia nights that occur on Wednesday nights. There are always some regular teams as well as some teams that come and go. I was new to the area but the friends I made at Dubliner have really helped me enjoy my time in San Francisco. 

Kaire is an amazing bartender as well. She bartends on Monday, Wednesday (trivia) and Saturday nights. She always takes care of me and every so often she'll surprise me with one of her signature "tic-tacs." I highly suggest stopping by this bar as it is one of my favorites. I can't comment on the other nights because I have never went on a night other than when Kaire is bartending.
author: Alex M.

description:
1) They have Blue Moon, my absolute favorite AND they serve it with an orange as it should be served, not with a lemon like many of the bars in the city do

2) Trivia night on Wed is oh so fun.  I suck and always lose but still somehow manage to talk my trivia skills up to everyone else in the bar and love that they have a good attitude about it
author: Johanna W.

description: I collect old man bars like Donald Trump collects supermodels, and The Dubliner is the crown jewel of my collection.  What she lacks in space she more than makes up for in courteous service and a ton of 80s metal on the jukebox.  Break out the Marlboros, because it's always a long night at the Dub.
author: Michael D.

description:
Staff rocks here, crowd rocks, what more do you need. 

This is one of my favorite bars in town, I haven't been back in a week or so and I feel like I miss it so much, which must be a good sign.

I have to second that he crowd is diverse, and varies per night, which is what a pub should be: a fun local place for everyone to have a pint and some craic.
author: Christian H.

description: Cheap drinks on Thursday nights, but I can't think of any other reason to go there. Not a place to avoid, but unless you find yourself wandering through West Portal (and really, why would you be doing that?!) then you shouldn't go out of your way to experience this slightly dingy bar. In their defense, they've got a pooltable and they weren't assholes, so they avoid the one-star slamming that they might have otherwise received.
author: Peter F.

description: This place gets really crowded on Saturday nights and they only have ONE BARTENDER!!! She is so overworked!!! She has to tend bar, clear and clean tables, and because she is sooooo busy, don't count on ordering your drink and being able to actually drink it until almost last call. The actual bar is nice. The pool table is upstairs and it over looks all the patrons standing at the bar waiting to be served.
author: Chantel S.

description:
I like beer. I like pool. Pool table is free. Wait, what? Yes... free. At least it was last night. And I had one really good run. But overall I was doing much better at knocking all my opponents balls in the holes. Technically he won 2 games and I won 1, BUT I did knock more balls in the holes, so I am telling myself I won. Seems completely fair to me. Plus my mom taught me that girls get to make the rules at stuff like this.

This place is definitely a neighborhoody bar with beer and locals who talk to you and beat you at doubles in pool. 

Once again, I can't believe I live like 5 blocks away and I never come here. I am so going out in West Portal more often. Stumbling home is way more fun than cabbing home. And I got like an extra thousand steps for my pedometer contest.
author: Ali R.

description:
Situated towards the end of the 'portal stroll'. 
My date and I stopped in here after our Grindhouse double feature. 
The two cute flirty girl-bartenders gave an excellent pour, 
and indulged patrons with witty conversation. 
We had a gush-fest about the recent
Pedro Aldomovar film Volver. 
My drink* (mount gay,ginger ale,lots of lime,dash of bitters)
was excellently executed each time. 
I shall visit again. . . .



*ccLisa G.
author: Kia B.

description:
Cute neighborhood bar that gets pretty packed during happy hour and on the weekends. 
A few tables along the wall and there's an upstairs lounge area. I saw a pool tables upstairs and quickly ran up. "Where do the quarters go? *looks around the table* Wait it's free!? SCORE!" Now to brush up on my skills or lack thereof.

A handful of tvs behind the bar to watch the game. Fully stocked bar and drinks specials everyday. Clientele include very cool neighborhood peeps and suits from the financial businesses down the block. Walls are plastered with sport posters of Bay Area sports teams (of course).
author: Lola L.

description:
I live nearby this bar, so it's a handy little place to get a drink.  I only frequent bars with clean bathrooms and I have to say, this place does a pretty good job keeping their bathrooms clean.  They have a pool room upstairs that is usually unoccupied, and good if you have a group of people with you.  
The bartenders are nice and if you spend lots of money, they aren't against giving you one or two drinks on the house.  That's always a plus!
It would be nicer if there were a few more attractive people there and fewer freaky middle-aged guys trying to grope my hair!
author: K M.

description:
When I first walked into this place it was empty ... Let me clarify, When I first walked into this place I was smiling, then I noticed it was empty and I continued smiling because I was gonna start drinking ... and it was only 2pm on a Monday afternoon. 

The good ...
They have all the traditional bar drinks, no food, a pinball machine, and one of those new internet jukeboxes that can play anything if you pay.

The bad ...
The new "fake-wood" paneling and shiny decor makes this place "not so irish" feeling. The bartender, with an irish-accent, responded with "Yeah it's been revamped" after I questioned her why the place felt so new. I expected a few more dents in the walls and more teethmarks in the bar wood.

And the ugly ...
In a grid like fashion they had repetitive sports "greatest moments" pictures hung on the wall illuminated by the standard pool table style green lamps.
author: Chris S.

description:
Stop #1 on the West Portal Pub Tour...

As expected, I spent most of the time here in waiting-for-peeps mode, until Arturo showed up.  Luckily I had the 49ers-Raiders exhibition game to keep me company,  but I almost made the mistake of cheering at a 49ers touchdown...turns out the Irish dudes in here were Raiders fans.  And you don't antagonize Raiders fans.  Nevertheless, this is not a Shannon Arms-style, Irish-pool-table-brawl dive.   With the wood-paneling, the art-deco GGNRA posters, and the little LCDs, it's actually rather polished (albeit in a soulless type of way), not unlike the Dubliner in Noe Valley.

It's also a bit overpriced for being so out of the way (and largely deserted).  $5.50 for a Guinness?  That's kind of stretching it.  Still, the balcony with a pool table was pretty nifty...this could definitely be a good venue for pub quiz.
author: Wes M.

description: I decided to go here since I was meeting someone. It was a Sat night which I thought was strange but oh well. Erin came up to us and told us about happy hour which was about to end. We each ordered two drinks. After my friend left I had three more shots and Erin said she was buying that last one for me, asked her if she was sure, and she said I ordered enough. She was so nice and not one of those bartenders that comes back every few minutes to ask for an order,which can be annoying. Told her I would come back for her great service.
author: Tanya B.

description:
While I still have some small gripes with one of the bartenders, overall, my first review was not totally justified for the score. 

This bar is a good place to go out. They typically have a younger crowd there, which is nice for an Irish pub. There is always free pool on Tuesdays and Trivia on Wednesdays which make for fun ways to enjoy the bar. The upstairs is a great place to go with a group. 

Overall a good place to either meet new people or meet up with old friends.
author: Jason S.

description:
Easy parking.
Friendly bartenders (although sometimes they can be a pain about carding, which a sort of understand)
Decent pours.
Reasonable prices.
The crowd for Sunday night bingo is completely different than Friday night. Try coming on various nights.
Their Bingo and Trivia nights are a lot of fun.
You can get cheap drink specials till 10pm

Convenient location for Muni lines.
author: Greg B.

description: met up a date here and I have to say the place is really chill. A good little pub in west portal. Drinks aren't expensive, pool table upstairs, and they even had some goof on the mic doing trivia with the patrons. They have plenty of tvs if u wanna catch a game. It def has a good vibe with good buzzed people. Will go back if around the area!
author: Eric S.

description:
I'm not much for bars, but this place warrants an honorable mention.  Reason: I once ordered a grasshopper and the bartender girl had no idea how to make one.  Instead of asking me what to put in it, she asked some of the old guys sitting further down the bar.  I think one of them said Midori, because she asked "Midori doesn't go in it, does it?"  No, honey.  Anyway, here's the good part.  She finally gets the right stuff together and gives me friggin 8 ounces of the grasshopper.  PLUS the shaker with the leftover that wouldn't fit.  I was set for the whole night.  Don't remember ordering it ever again, (not because it wasn't good because it was) but i just don't want to get disappointed with a dinky two-ouncer.

upgraded this to 3 stars, because i ordered a grasshopper again and again it was huge!  love it.  and man, the bartender lady always cracks me up.  a third of the time we just smile and nod because we have no idea what she's saying.  but whatever she's saying, i'm sure it's funny because she's so emphatic about it.  whatever it is.
author: spiff e.

description:
Great little neighborhood bar..... Solid drinks... good atmosphere... They have a couple tv's as well...

We will go back again..
author: Joe B.

description: The Dubliner doesn't feel like an authentic Irish pub, probably because it's too clean and the decor is pretty generic.  It's a little cramped and the parking is tough.  The TVs are great if you're trying to catch a game.  Drinks are average price and I like that they take cards.  Something about the atmosphere just feels depressing, and it's like that every time I go in there (about once every 6 months). I'd give it 3 stars except they have two awesome women's restrooms.  That's right, two.  Way to go, Dubliner, now we're talking.
author: Elisabeth G.

description: I go all the time for 3 dollar drinks on Thursday nights.  That and the friendly bartenders are what make this place.  It is a great place to start your Thursday night and If you get enough drinks in during the 2 hour "cheap period" it may just be a great place to end your night . . .if you know what I mean . . . You may be drunk.
author: Colin L.

description:
Upstairs pool table that overlooks the bar = awesome
Closest bar to my house (2 minute walk) = awesome

Like any respectable Irish pub, they have decent beers on tap and okay prices.  Not as cheap as Portal's or as divey, so the Dubliner is generally relegated to a mere one-shot bar, unless the pool table is unoccupied, in which case I like to hang out here for an hour or so

on certain nights there are some rather attractive bartenders in the mix, which may or may not sway my group to stick around for longer
author: Kyle W.

description:
As Ice Cube once said, "Yeah... yeah! Fool -- you know how we do it".  
Great place to get together with the homies and shoot some dice.  I witnessed a good fight here last Thanksgiving.  When the cops showed up, I felt compelled to inform Lt. Wong that 25 years ago, my dad was shot here when it was TK's.  He was not interested in my story  so I threw up some WP gang signs and bounced.  Just trying to keep it real..."coming from the west side west side, coming from west side".
author: Micaela M.

description:
Cleanliness is not a priority here. Alcohol is supposed to kill germs so I'm sure that in the end it's sanitary but who knows for sure. I thought I'd try a new vodka so Vox and tonic it was. I usually drink from the tiny stir straws in the drink and this time, they had an odd "flavor" to them. That was a first. If I think too much more about this I'll probably be sick so I'll just leave it at that.

From the banter at the bar, the half dozen or so people there were regulars and lived in the neighborhood. Really low-key place and fairly quiet except for a couple of guys who had at least two too many.

I heard there's a pool table on the second floor but I didn't make it that far --- the talk of broken glass and a belligerent male gave me cause to think twice about heading up there.
author: Kristi K.

description:
I went here on a Sunday afternoon about a month ago.  This is a cool neighborhood bar (not my neighborhood though).  It wasn't crowed, and the people there were regulars.
They had several ESPN channels on.  The flat screens are small, but cool to watch!
They have a great selection of bears and it's a nice clean and friendly bar to chill out in when in West Portal.
author: Yamil A.

description: Let's put it this way: the highlight of a visit with my friends is my friend's dad shows up with his usual hilarity.  It's a good spot to visit, watch some sports, or play some trivia.  I would consider this my neighborhood bar if I still lived in the area, but since the West Portal nightlife is on the nonexistent side, it's not really a go-to destination
author: P D.

description: The dubliner on west portal is my favortive bar. its chill, you can always find good music in the neverending selection on their juke box. i can count on the dubliner for a beer and game! The bartenders always remember me even when i havent been there in a while, and they always know to poor me a blue moon! love this place. its comfortable, the service is good, and well i work right accross the street so...ya....even better! oh ya, and purse hooks. they have hooks to hang your purse or coat on under the bar. ya i know a lot of places have them, but youd be surprised at how many dont. good service, good music, blue moon on tap and purse hooks...thats what makes a good bar! am i right or am i right?!
author: Michelle E.

description:
I think I may have found a new neighborhood bar.  

I know I proclaimed my love of  Joxer Daly's as a neighborhood bar earlier, but now Joxer Daly's has a strong competitor.  

This place is bright, modern, cherry, has pool tables, a pin ball machine, a jukebox, and takes credit cards ( which I am finding out more and more, alot of smaller  neighborhood bars don't take).  

The bartenders are fun and friendly.  The drinks are cheap, for the 4 hours we were there, we had at least 3 Irish coffees, 2 Irish Car Bombs, and at least 6 Jack and Cokes, 4 beers and our total tab was about $50.  (2 of our drinks were on the house!).  

The crowd is younger than Joxer Daly's-more people in our age range (25-30) than and less of the older crowd which is fine-we felt more in our element here.  Everyone was hanging out and having a good time and as we like, almost every seat was taken yet there was still room to move around.    

What more can you ask for in a neighborhood bar?
author: Denise B.

description:
Otto is back!  My boycott of the Dubliner is officially over.  I went here to begin my St. Patty's blackout and she delivered!  Irish Car Bombs are still the devil.  

Pool table, darts, free food on the Holiday, and I love to get involved in the petty squabbles between the different cute bartenders.  I hear Kaira is a bitch, but i like her just fine.  She's a little tiny thing and I think she might have magical powers.  And their accents!  All these girls talk fancy.  The only place I've ever been called a 'cheeky geezer' and where I learned that English people don't say 'drunk at work' they say 'pissed on shift'.  Fancy.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
I don't know about you, but to me, the main function of a bar is to provide alcohol. The bars main goal is to make money, I understand that, but somehow, (and call me old fashioned) I think this could be done while providing good alcohol! 
  I am not by any means a prissy little bitch, but I, like most people, do not like when people insult my intelligence. When we ordered Grey Goose the response was "I think we're out"... yet 3 mins later she realized they weren't, and served us the "grey goose" shot. It was skyy and water poured into a GG bottle. No, I'm not mistaken. I could taste the fuckin water! Ok, so we didn't mention it to the bartender that we knew we were being cheated... ordered something else the rest of the night. The lemon drop was gross... hardly any lemon taste with a touch of sugar... and I saw her pouring god knows what in that drink.... a god lemon drop just requires vodka, lots of lemon juice and sugar (and maybe some lemon liquor if u gonna go all the way here)... but ok, I let that go too. Then my friend (who wasn't drinkin vodka that night) bought us shots of Grey goose... this time it was Stoli and water. 
The Dubliner failed at its primary function. The atmosphere was cool though (minus the idiot that tried to say that I drink vodka solely because of the fact that I'm a female... if u gonna go there, why don't we get into the fact that I'm russian as well) 
Soooo I'm cool off this spot... I'll go drink somewhere else from now on
author: Zee L.

description:
Friday 3/14 My Hood Spot was happening. I got some Green Beads, Heineken Bottle Openers and other Irish Drink Up Schwag.


 I am loved and recognized here. The owner supports Irish Son Barack Obama. They received mucho Obama posters etc.


 The jukebox is digital and has excellent selections of Old School Rock & Roll, Hip Hop, World Music etc..


 They serve great bar snack food. The pints are a decent price. Great Selection of all kinds of booze.


 Tables, Pool Table, ATM 
Plentiful Bathrooms, Parking Galore( After 5:00pm)


 This used to be an old crusty bar. It has been remodeled. Lots of big screen TV's. CNN is always on. Infodiva's kind of bar.


 If I get too inebriated I can Walk home. West Portal is fairly safe.


 Cheers to ya!
author: Infodiva B.

description:
I recently moved to the Portal and I've been testing the strip to find my new local.
I'm a little undecided about The Dubliner. They have a great mezzanine pool table, it is well worn but the pool is free on Sundays and I think Monday as well. You do need to be careful not to break some of the small glass panes of the balcony wall overlooking the rest of the bar; you can see where a few have been knocked out by the end of a pool cue.
Another plus for this bar is the happy-hours. $3 pretty much anything, well drinks and guinness etc. Where else can you get a pint of guinness for $3???
It is in the dive bar category and gets a bit cramped very quickly during happy hour.
The main thing that bugs me about this place is that they let dogs into the bar. I've been a few times where there has been a dog or two wandering up and down the room. Now the dogs are generally well behaved, well trained, but it just seems unhygienic to me. I've even seen a dog sitting up on a barstool. The bar staff did tell it to get down when they noticed, but at the end of the day, a dog has sat on that barstool.
So overall, not a bad pub. Cheap drinks if you time it right and often a dog or two to pet if you like that sort of thing.
author: Kes A.

description:
My favorite neighborhood pub thus far.  First time here was on St. Pattys Day.  The girl who made my drink is one on my most favorite people ever.  Order 1 Long Island, and you're well on your way to a good night. Add the happy hour special- Long Islands for $3... hope you call a cab home.
Good atmosphere, good drinks, bar tenders are nice to look at, pool tables, tvs, and no super annoying drunks as of yet.
Ace.
author: Darian H.

description: Awesome bartenders...$3 drinks on Thursdays for college night.  Just wish they had food.
author: Marlie H.

description:
I go here about once or twice a month with my soccer buddies. The best reason to go is named Kristine and she tends the bar while dispensing carrot sticks and other roughage to the sozzled regulars. Otherwise it has nothing to recommend it. Oh, and they took down the TK's sign so now I have trouble finding it from the street.

July update: Kristine's gone, prices still high. Time to find a new hole. They lose one star.
author: jim b.

description: On a rare sunny and warm day on the "west side," a perfectly cold Smithwick's is just what I needed. The $5.75 price wasn't.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
So randomly the other night (while I was trying to study) my friends decided to take me out to this bar. It's a little small, but has a welcoming atmosphere. It was actually pretty packed, I believe it was a Thursday, but even so we were able to get drinks within a minute or two of walking in. Bartenders are SO nice, especially the one with the accent. 
BEST PART: the pool table/balcony thing that looked over the bar. We could play and keep track of our drunk friends at the same time! GENIUS! 
Drinks could have been better priced.
author: Michelle W.

description: Best pub in West Portal with a pool table that overlooks the rest of the bar. Plus $3 beers during happy hour. SOLD!
author: Kyle B.

description: Came in for a quick stop for a potty break. Then decided  to have a corona with some friends and chatted up with some locals there. A corona cost me $6/7, you can get a 6pack for that much!! The bartender, i forget her name, pretty blonde girl-very sweet. It was late, closing on two in the morning. A few others were upstairs playing pool and having a couple drinks. Overall the ambiance was chill and alright. Would possibly come back after work to hang out or take another potty break early in the morning haha.
author: Fat C.

description:
this bar is pretty awesome. after church on a sunday, you know the first thing you'll want is a drink......

well if that is how you feel, then there's nothing better to do than hang out with old anglo saxons at the dubliner.

i've come here twice now. It is an awesome bar, a great place to watch the game and grab some beers and play some pool. i am sure that i am not what they would call "the usual crowd" but i have fun there. i actually dont know why im writing this review... i dont want a horde of people here on sundays.
author: Garrett W.

description: IN THE AFTERNOON, WITH A POOL TABLE UPSTAIRS, BIG PLUS. Too bad the pool is not free, but aye, where is it? Decent prices on drinks for the area. think it was about 20 bux for two stellas and two jamos, so ya, i'm sure its a lively place in the eve.
author: Daniel M.

description: I was just here earlier today and can I say that I love the bartenders, very friendly and sweet. Its definitely a great hang out spot especially for watching this summer's olympics. If you are in the West Portal area and are looking for a drink I recommend stopping in this charming pub for a chat and a drink!
author: Dora L.

description: Well.... I have to somewhat agree w/ my so called "friend" - even though I recommended the bar to her --  I would say that this is the kind of place that if you want an ok beer on tap and want to unwind on a weekday night, then it's a great place to go.  It's the kind of place where it's more of a neighborhood hangout -- the few times I have gone -- the same bartenders are working along with a few of the regulars sitting at the bar.  There is a cute little pool table upstairs, that if you're lucky you can enjoy and use as more a of a private room -- b/c if you're not playing pool there is really no other reason to hang out upstairs (it can get pretty warm).
author: Melanie R.

description: $3 drinks Thursday night from 8-10.  They usually have the Giant's game on.  Bartenders (Otto and Erin) are terrific.  Can't think of a better way to spend an evening.  Plus, there's always this one drunk guy there and I ask how he is and his trademark response of "Fucked up" makes me smile every time.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Eh, this place is just ok. My friend said it's "really cool." But I disagree. I don't think I've ever paid as much for a pitcher of Stella as I did here, but I guess sometimes that's what you have to do. It was unbearably hot when I went and the seating by the bar is narrow. Upstairs is a pool table that overlooks the bar, which is pretty cool, but not cool enough to warrant another star. Also, the pool table is small and plays fast; not really a fan of having my ass kicked by the dudes who have essentially forced me into playing against them. Either way, this place isn't too bad, just not very remarkable and kind of blah. Maybe if you're a regular you have a different take...
author: Veronica W.

description: The yummy toasties advertised really are pretty yummy.  Like the grilled cheese sammiches I used to make in my dorm room when everything was closed.  Just don't watch her make it because I don't think she washes her hands.  I survived, but perhaps your immune system isn't as evolved.  Does that make me sound dirty?  I dunno. whatever.  Oh and once you become more of a regular, you'll pick up what the bartendress is actually saying, because she speaks the wildest craziest cockney I have ever heard.  Like a mouthful of marbles, this one.  It's also likely that she is always 3 sheets by the time we hit up the Dubliner, which is usually pretty late.  All in all, I like this bar for being quaint.  Much more polished than TK's used to look though the clientele still includes those tenacious dirty old geezers that like to touch k.m's long dark hair.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Place is depressing and the TV screens everywhere you turn make it even worse. But th,ere is Boddingtons on tap, thus 2 stars.
author: Three B.

description: Everytime I come here, there's about two or three people, including the bartender.  And the bartender is fucking crazy.  I adore her.  And I've only been here two or three times.  She recognizes me.  I feel special.  But moving on.  I got drunk here, on not much money.  Which is good, because I'm broke-ass.  Sometimes it's nice to go to a bar that is basically deserted, without it being creepy.  The drinks are potent.  And the bartender makes me laugh.  Oh, and it's a rerally short walk from where I live.
author: Angela H.

description: I love this bar because it is close to my house.  i also love it because it is mostly locals not annoying dbags
author: Miguel h.

description:
this place is fine for those who don't mind drinking very average beers out of the bottle and enjoy watching sports in bars (a significant amount of tvs throughout the bar), BUT for a beer snob--a nightmare. 4 skunky pours for 4 different types of beer. 

a plus for the cozy upstairs pool room overlooking the bar that no one seemed to care for, where i enjoyed a few games.
author: Cathy C.

description: Dart boards are the only thing that could improve this bar. It's got a relaxed vibe and very friendly staff. The jukebox is great and the bathrooms are clean (super important).
author: Rachel B.

description: Even dive bars shouldn't allow dogs.  We came about 1am on a Friday night (well, i guess technically Saturday morning).  The nicest part of the bar is the second floor which has a pool table and a view of the bar.  Its your basic sports bar, its alright, nothing about which to write home.
author: Marc M.

description: I love the Dubliner!!! West Portal is a great little "town" within a city and The Dubliner is a great "local".  We go to Trivia there every Wednesday...great times...cheap drinks...how could you beat it??  Erin is back as the bartender there on Wednesday nights..and she Rocks!!!  Thanks Dubliner for a mid week get-a-way!!
author: J C.

description: Stopped here to meet friends for a birthday thing after old krakow. Not too crowded for a Saturday night, efficient, funny, and very nice estonian bar maid kept the shots and beer flowing. Fun time.
author: Scott M.

description:
so here's the deal:

real irish bartenders
generic beer selection
old white fat neighborhood men
POOL TABLE UPSTAIRS THAT IS UNDERUTILIZED

honestly, it's the only reason i come here. i figure the rest of the crowd is too lazy to make it up the stairs or they just want to watch the game (tvs all around).
author: selma s.

description: I like to go to this bar; Hank the bartender is great and the local cliental is quite friendly.
author: Kim F.

description: Ok, I'm writing about all my favorite places, so it seems that I'm being generous today. This is my old neighborhood bar. I brought my East Bay friends to it on my bday and they were veryyy impressed. They also went to Sushi Suki next door. They really dug the vibe and there was something for everyone. The bartenders are gorgeous, the clientele friendly, and there are food joints everywhere so you can fill up before you start the cocktailing. Tons of tvs for games if you are into that, and a great jukebox that the bartenders will sing along to with u! Always super fun. People really look out for you too there, so if you go solo, you are always offered a cab by the staff.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Always fun times! Love the trivia night on wednesdays, great bartenders and all around fun place to go!
author: Jason S.

description: the boyfriend would not come in here after they took over TK's but I did with a friend. shh, don't tell. heh it didn't seem any different to me and that's not a bad thing. the drinks are still potent and I recognize some of the old clientele. out of pure laziness, I still prefer the Philly's b/c it's closer to the restaurants. the Dubliner is more out of the way and I hate wearing out the soles of my shoes. you understand.
author: Prima D.

description: Ok, I've only been here twice, but had the same basic experience.  Both times, there was the slowest elderly guy on the planet tending the bar. Note to old dude, I'm not "age-ist", really I'm not, but perhaps u should find another way to spend your retirement. You're not meant for this. Talking endlessly with the regulars and ignoring newly arrived thirsty customers, is NOT the way to tend bar.. (it wasn't busy) And, when u finally decide to pay attention, and slowly amble my way, and there's someone standing next to me, who, by the way, came in after me, perhaps you should know that you can, oh yes, it IS possible, to take 2 people's orders at once!  Taking one order and doing your Tim Conway shuffle back down the bar to carefully "prepare" the next beer, a guinness no less, and waiting until it is complete before continuing your questionable attentiveness, is, yet again, NOT the way to tend bar. To give proper credit elsewhere, the British woman, who comes on later to help the elderly lad, is very good at tending bar and a lot of fun too. And its a nice, clean bar, with several HDTV's for us sports fans. For these reasons, and the fact that the beer arrives ice cold, in a clean, frosty cold pint glass, (are you reading this Joxers?) I will be back. I just realized. Maybe the old guy is actually the owner. Wouldn't that kinda of make him the Al Davis of pub owners? Maybe they should both stop meddling in the day to day business!
author: Rich M.
